conclusion: There are several identical small steel balls released from a certain position on an inclined plane every 0.1 seconds without initial velocity.
The photograph has a 1:1 scale relationship with the actual object.
The image shows several small steel balls rolling on the inclined plane, with positions labeled A, B, and C.
It is measured that AB = 15 cm and BC = 20 cm.
The distance traveled by the balls increases uniformly due to the constant acceleration down the incline.
The distance traveled by a body in uniform acceleration is given by s = ut + (1/2)at^2, where u is the initial velocity, a is the acceleration, and t is the time.

premise: AB = 15 cm, BC = 20 cm, time interval = 0.1 seconds
conclusion: The distance AB is traveled in time t1, so AB = (1/2)a(t1 + 0.1)^2 - (1/2)a(t1)^2 = 15 cm.

conclusion: The distance BC is traveled in time t2, so BC = (1/2)a(t2 + 0.1)^2 - (1/2)a(t2)^2 = 20 cm.
